subject: Cybersecurity
title: Net Neutrality: Equal Access to the Digital Highway
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Net Neutrality: Equal Access to the Digital Highway.

hook.text: Should your ISP be able to slow down Netflix and speed up its own streaming service? Net neutrality says no.

buildup.text: Net neutrality means ISPs must treat all internet traffic equally â€” no blocking, throttling, or paid prioritization.

discovery.text: Without net neutrality, ISPs could create 'fast lanes' for companies that pay more and 'slow lanes' for everyone else.

twist.text: The US repealed net neutrality rules in 2017. Portugal showed what could happen: ISPs sold separate packages for.

climax.text: Net neutrality is about power: whether ISPs become gatekeepers deciding which content succeeds and which is buried.

punchline.text: Pay extra for social media. Pay extra for video. Pay extra for everything.

quiz.question: What would happen without net neutrality protections?
options: Internet speeds would increase for everyone
ISPs could create paid fast lanes and throttle competing services
All websites would be equally fast
